result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Darren D Merrill was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation no later than 8/16/2016.
Must follow rules of Probation.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $1,694.00 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.

Subject to Good Time & Work Release.  
Court finds 48-hour initial component completed.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Absolute Sobriety.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Tribal rules may not apply to tribal elections.
Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must provide a DNA sample.  No surcharge.
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
6 months upfront.  
6 months banked for use by Probation if necessary.
Sentence credit of 81 days to be applied to the 6 months upfront.
May have release for purpose of working on house/homemaker.  
May serve time at another County if at no cost to Polk County.  
Furlough granted until 9/3/2016, by 6:30 p.m. to report to Polk County unless Defendant has worked out reporting to another County jail.
